alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Florence, northeastern Darlington and southern Marlboro Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 452 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mont Clare, or near Darlington. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Darlington, Quinby, Dovesville, Mechanicsville, Mont Clare, Darlington Raceway, Floyd and Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus. This includes Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 164 and 169. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
